column4: in a multiuser x server, is there a way I can disable the use of an xterm for all users except administrators?
I am working on a project that needs that
I need to disable not only xterm but any program that can let the user run a command
that will be quite a task.. since just launching an icon is technically running a command
theres some lockdown tools  and restricted shells you may want to look into
or try changeing their default shell. but that may break X/some programs also
that is why I am using fvwm with my customized settings that has no access to xterm,   but I can think of ways to get arround it
thers always the console also..    With proper security settings users having access to the command line is not a security issue
it is in my system, since I am charging money to run applications
I dont want people running applications withought my permission
time to read up/google on restricting shell accounts i guess then. So the users are just doing what exactly? sshing in? running X over xdmcp? vnc?
I dont want to disclose all the details of my project, but I think you got the idea
sounds liek a lot of work for very little gain.. but good luck.
thanx, but I dont want my users to have access to any shell, only to the applications I willk serve them
